{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3262823,"name":"Agasthya Bhatia","username":"Agasthya9692","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a9adbd/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-12-09T14:37:48.517Z","cooked":"

Hello, this is Agasthya from Team #9692. After we set up the robo rio using imaging tool, we tried to configure the radio but we encountered an error with the phrase “Bridge configuration failed. Could not locate bridge. Please ensure that - Wifi connections are disabled on this computer- the wireless bridge is the only device connected via ethernet. If this error still occurs after the above conditions are met, try power cycling or manually resetting the bridge”.

We did try to solve this issue by disabling the firewall and disabling the wifi adapter but we continued to face this issue. We were about 1/4th of the way there through configuration when we experienced this pop-up.

Hope that we can receive some help towards this error.

WhatsApp Image 2023-12-09 at 7.48.43 PM1600×900 106 KB

Did you give the radio power and enough time to complete booting up?
Does the radio show a blue ethernet connection light from your PC?
Are any other network connectors from the PC also disabled?
You can try a different PC as a test.

Following the directions here: Programming your Radio — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation
(It has a picture labeling the radio status lights you should be seeing.)

open control panel (NOT settings), hit the search button and type “network connections” and click the “View network connections” entry

image858×223 14.7 KB

for example, mine looks like this ^

EDIT:
an adapter is disabled if it is grayed out, such as the Bluetooth Network Connection and Wi-Fi on my screenshot.

ensure that for yours, everything is grayed out except ethernet
